The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include new credits for flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicles and qualified alternative fuel motor vehicles. Subsection (e) introduces the new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicle credit. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 introduces a new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicle credit under subsection (e). This credit applies to new hybrid flexible fuel motor vehicles placed in service during the taxable year, with the credit amount determined according to a specified table. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 introduces a new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicle credit under subsection (e). The credit amount is determined based on the city fuel economy percentage compared to a comparable vehicle, ranging from $1,500 to $3,500. The new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicle credit under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is based on city fuel economy percentages compared to a comparable vehicle. The vehicle's fuel economy is determined on an E-85 ethanol gallon equivalent basis, while the comparable vehicle's fuel economy is determined on a gasoline gallon equivalent basis. A new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicle is defined as a vehicle capable of operating on alternative fuel, gasoline, and any blend of the two. The term 'new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicle' refers to a qualified hybrid vehicle that can run on alternative fuel, gasoline, or a blend of both. It must achieve a city fuel economy using E-85 ethanol that is at least 125% of a comparable nonhybrid vehicle's city fuel economy fueled by gasoline. This subsection does not apply to vehicles eligible for the new qualified hybrid motor vehicle credit. The subsection (k) of section 30B of the Code is extended to include a new deadline for new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicles. Amendments are made to include these vehicles in the numeric limitation and make conforming amendments to the Code. The Code is amended to include new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicles in the numeric limitation and make conforming amendments. The Code is amended to include new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicles in the numeric limitation and make conforming amendments by inserting specific language in paragraphs (2), (3), and (5), amending subsection (b) of section 38, and adjusting paragraph (36) of section 1016(a). The Code is amended to include new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicles in the numeric limitation and make conforming amendments. Effective Date: Amendments apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2006.
